medium_description_en: Stages pancreatic cancer based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases.
instructions_en: This calculator is based on the 7th edition of the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. The 8th edition is now recommended for use over this version.

seo.meta_description_en: The TNM Staging for Pancreatic Cancer provides information about the severity of pancreatic cancer based on tumor, lymph node, and metastasis characteristics.
seo.keywords_en: TNM Staging for pancreatic cancer, pancreatic cancer, pancreatic ca, pancreas cancer, pancreas ca, panc ca tnm, pancreatic cancer tnm, pancreatic cancer staging, Panc, ca, cancer, pancreatitis, gallbladder, liver, chronic, prognosis

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: The TNM Staging System for pancreatic cancer is well known and widely used.
how_to_use.why_use_en: TNM staging classifies the extent of neoplastic disease and helps in prognosis and appropriate therapies.

next_steps.advice_en: TNM staging requires high quality advanced imaging and extensive lymph node evaluation.
next_steps.management_en: We are unaware of validated management algorithms using the TNM staging system.
next_steps.critical_actions_en: TNM staging requires high quality advanced imaging and extensive lymph node evaluation.

about.formula_en:
Staging based on multiple factors including:

  • Primary tumor (T)
  • Regional lymph nodes (N)
  • Distant metastasis (M)
about.more_info_en:
Stage 5-year survival rate
IA 14%
IB 12%
IIA 7%
IIB 5%
III 3%
IV 1%

Original/Primary Reference.text: Exocrine and endocrine pancreas. In: Edge SB, Byrd DR, Compton CC, et al., eds.: AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer, 2010, pp 241-9.

Other References.text: NIH National Cancer Institute Pancreatic Cancer Treatment (PDQ®)–Health Professional Version. Updated: February 5, 2016. Accessed: 5/18/2016
Tempero MA, et al. Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma. J Natl Compr Canc Netw 2010;8:972-1017.
American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) TNM staging system, September 6, 2013. American Cancer Society. Accessed: 5/18/2016.

creator_info.about_en: Stephen B. Edge, MD, FACS, FASCO, is an adjunct professor of surgery at Vanderbilt University and the current director of the Baptist Cancer Center. Dr. Edge has co-chaired the 2010 Breast Cancer Symposium and Guideline Panel for Postmastectomy Radiation and is serving on the editorial board of the Journal of Oncology Practice. His research focuses on staging systems and risk stratification for many types of cancers.

options.label: Tumor limited to pancreas, ≤2 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor limited to pancreas, >2 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor extends beyond pancreas but without involving celiac axis or Superior Mesenteric Artery (SMA)
Tumor involves celiac axis or SMA (unresectable primary)
Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
